However, I found that the alterantive link refered by Mike Clark's worked: =
http://www.clarkware.com/articles/junitprimer.html 

Good luck!
  ----- Ori=
ginal Message ----- 
  From: Andrew Zou 
  To: 'junit@yahoogroups.com' 
  S=
ent: Wednesday, May 30, 2001 11:06 AM
  Subject: RE: [junit] testing junit
=


  I think this link( http://junit.sourceforge.net/doc/cookbook/cookbook.h=
tm) does not work any more. Does any body know the mirror site or they move=
d this page to where.

  Thanks.

  Andrew
    -----Original Message-----
 =
   From: Philippe Vanpeperstraete [mailto:philippe.vanpeperstraete@skynet.b=
e]
    Sent: Wednesday, May 30, 2001 11:48 AM
    To: junit@yahoogroups.com=

    Subject: RE: [junit] testing junit


    Did you look under the "docum=
entation" tab, there, you'll find the JUnit cookbook, which is a pretty goo=
d start, if you get your Java environment straight.

    regards
    Philip=
pe

      From: Ram Kumar [mailto:y_ramkuma=
r@...]

      Hi,

      I am=
 a new JUnit user and just downloaded JUnit and trying to work with it. I c=
ould not find proper documentation about how to install JUnit and use it, i=
n JUnit site.

      Could any one suggest me where to find good documentat=
ion about JUnit?

      Awaiting your immediate reply.

      Thanks,

    =
  Yamasani.
